posts.title: US IRS chief to quit over deal to share data with immigration officials, report says
top_comments: Illegal attempts to access IRS data was an article of impeachment against Nixon
Remember when trump sued the irs to prevent them from sharing his tax returns with congress and it took years and went all the way to the Supreme Court?
Don't worry. Her position will be filled by a DOGE high schooler ASAP.
Why would the IRS have data on illegal immigrants, MAGA? I thought illegal immigrants didn't pay taxes, MAGA? If they're paying taxes, why do they need to go, MAGA?
Is this legal? Oh wait, nvm.
Wait, illegal immigrants don't contribute anything. How does the IRS have their data? - some maga guy probably
We just keep losing more and more talent due to this administration’s actions. I’m no fan of paying taxes. And the IIRS certainly needs some work. But we can’t function this way.
The more of these people quit, the more open positions they can put anyone into. At the same time, I totally get quitting. You’re not about to make me do something absolutely batshit crazy.
That's the sort of thing you don't *quit* over. Stick around, drag it out, and make it their problem!

No worries, they’ll just keep on putting in someone who doesn’t care about the rule of law. Not that hard to find. Kudos to this third person who quit over this very concerning weaponization of tax information.

Why should your ordinary citizen submit anything to the IRS, if the IRS is now showing it’s not private? Because what this means is that the IRS will now provide your personal information (and nobody knows that more than the IRS), to whatever authority asks for it.

The only reason this voluntary tax disclosure of very private information to the IRS has lasted as long as it had is because people have trusted that this info will be used by the IRS for tax purposes only, not to be given out freely to ICE or whoever says they need it for unprecedented purposes.

posts.title: 'Time for you to abandon the United States': Asylum seekers who used app being told to leave
top_comments: I was told by someone that I was making a “big deal” over the Mass Deportations Now signs at his rallies.

The asylum seeker issue is proof that Republicans do not actually support legal immigration. They think that being an "illegal immigrant" is an innate quality, closely tied to your ethnicity and the color of your skin, not simply the lack of immigration paperwork.

Seeking asylum in the US is legal. You may disagree with the law, but these people were following the law. They are not illegal immigrants. They are legal immigrants following a process that you don't like. The same was true of the Haitian immigrants that JD Vance made up those disgusting lies about. It has always been racism and xenophobia.

Good advice for everyone, honestly.

Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free."

posts.title: Keystone Pipeline ruptures near Fort Ransom
top_comments: Literally nobody could have seen this coming /s
Good thing that Republicans are okay with oil pollution, this area couldn't be more Red.

This is from a story in 2012

"Even after causing more than a dozen spills in 2011 from its newest tar sands pipeline — including a six story “geyser” of crude — Canadian energy developer TransCanada claimed its planned Keystone XL pipeline would “exceed” safety standards.

But according to a new investigation of TransCanada’s development plans, the company does not plan to use advanced spill prevention technologies on a section of pipeline that would cross an underground reservoir providing nearly 30 percent of America’s irrigation water.

InsideClimate Newsreported this week that TransCanada would only use standard leak detection technologies across a 19-mile stretch of the pristine Ogallala Aquifer, making bigger leaks more likely."

  
We were told these pipelines were leakproof which led to the idea it doesnt need monitoring. Remember when gigantic corporations say "Regulations are killing their buisness" theyre saying spending money on technology to prevent problems lowers profits.
Funny how the oil disasters always happens right after the price of oil goes below $60.
Shutdown in two minutes is the only good thing about this.
They must’ve used the same kind of glue that Tesla used to attach the body panels to the cyber truck
Wow, exactly the thing protesters were saying was going to happen fucking happened
Shocking how much the Keystone pipeline and it's surrounding terrain looks like the Trans-Alaska Pipeline

So, I worked the Natural Gas pipeline for a while, and know a bit about hiw these things are supposed to be protected. I know a specialist will be brought in to determine the cause of the rupture, and I'd be very curious about the results. 

For the record, 11 years isn't really enough time for any rust to drill through that steel, and the coating is supposed to last 40 years. I've seen badly applied stuff that started to fail after 10 years. My money's on welding failure.
It's not "if" a pipeline will leak, it's "when." Americans don't care about the "when" as long as it's not in their backyard.

posts.title: Musk's DOGE using AI to snoop on U.S. federal workers, sources say
top_comments:
Big Brother is watching.

https://www.upi.com/Voices/2025/03/06/DOGE-government-data-danger/2551741269965/

This is **not** your standard company snooping to check you’re at your desk!

> Trump administration officials have told some U.S. government employees that Elon Musk’s DOGE team of technologists is using artificial intelligence to **surveil at least one federal agency’s communications for hostility to President Donald Trump and his agenda**, said two people with knowledge of the matter.

> At the Environmental Protection Agency, for instance, some EPA managers were told by Trump appointees that Musk’s team is **rolling out AI to monitor workers, including looking for language in communications considered hostile to Trump or Musk**, the two people said.

Summary:

> - DOGE uses AI to monitor communications for anti-Trump sentiment, sources say
> - DOGE’s use of Signal app raises data security and transparency concerns
> - Musk’s DOGE team accused of bypassing vetting processes, operating in secrecy

Yes, ‘sources say’. This is Reuters, I can guarantee they’ve vetted those sources.
I hear Signal is now an approved messaging app for discussing special plans. Maybe federal workers could look into a Signal chat group to escape DOGE's Big Brother.
Very normal events happening in a very normal country.
Realistically, Trump+Musk now easily have access to the tools to dox every poster here.
Someday soon grok is going to reveal itself as a mole and blow this whole thing wide open

“Be careful what you say, what you type and what you do,”

The fact that Ontario’s measles outbreak has drawn concern from New York health officials highlights just how interconnected our public health systems truly are. Measles is a preventable disease, and its resurgence points to dangerous gaps in vaccination coverage and public trust. This isn’t just a local issue — it’s a cross-border wake-up call for stronger immunization strategies and coordinated public health responses.

posts.title: Tariffs on China set to rise to at least 104% on Wednesday, White House says
top_comments: we’re at “ban all direct trade with China” territory now

Is this thread going to stay up? This has been posted a few times and keeps getting deleted. Let me ask this one more time: 

Why is there no actual plan from the White House to actually spur new factories in the US? Why is the CHIP Act being dismantled? Where is the effort to actually do anything other than random tariff announcements that feel like they are being shot from the hip? If they were serious, there would be something like the CHIP act for all kinds of on-shoring manufacturing opportunities. They also need to address the US steel industry, rare earth metals (not by invading Greenland, lol), and so many other things.

This is the end of my career and industry.  It's now more cost effective for us to abandon product in china than it is to import it and distribute at a massive loss.

We're all probably going to lose our jobs.

* October 2024 - [Trump’s Tariffs Could Push S&P 500 Down 10% Next Year, UBS Says](https://www.forbes.com/sites/dereksaul/2024/10/10/trumps-tariffs-could-push-sp-500-down-10-next-year-ubs-says/)
* September 2024 - [These 5 parts of the stock market are most at risk if Trump wins the election and implements wide-reaching tariffs, Barclays says](https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/trump-tariff-trade-policy-stock-market-outlook-risk-election-china-2024-9) 
* May 2024 - [Trump’s new trade war would cost middle-class families at least $1,700 a year, report warns](https://www.cnn.com/2024/05/21/business/trump-trade-war-tariffs-china/index.html)
* December 2023 - [Tariffs Are for Losers](https://www.wsj.com/opinion/tariffs-are-for-losers-global-economy-protectionism-trade-jake-sullivan-hawley-585c4175)
* September 2023 - [Pence trashes Trump’s tax plan, says 10% tariff would ‘increase inflation at the worst possible time’](https://www.cnbc.com/2023/09/21/pence-trashes-trump-tax-plan-says-tariffs-would-worsen-inflation.html)
The fallout from this will be felt decades from now.
Mr Trump and the Republicans are hell bent of crashing the economy, increasing the prices of everything exponentially, and making the life of the working class Americans worse. Sad.
Those MAGA hats and tshirts are going to be expensive.

By mid-may the layoffs will be hitting if movement doesn't occur by then. At this point best to save as much as you can since it will be hard to say he will be effected directly, or by knock on effects as consumers cut back.
Trump has to make everybody his enemy before he negotiates. He is a child.
Is America winning yet?

posts.title: AP wins reinstatement to White House events after judge rules government can’t bar its journalists
top_comments:
> "Under the First Amendment, if the Government opens its doors to some journalists—be it to the Oval Office, the East Room, or elsewhere—it cannot then shut those doors to other journalists because of their viewpoints,” McFadden wrote. “The Constitution requires no less.”

The question is will this administration respect the ruling. They don't seem to have any respect for checks and balances, even though they're a cornerstone of our Constitution.

> U.S. District Judge Trevor N. McFadden, an appointee of President Donald Trump, ruled that the government can’t retaliate against the AP’s decision not to follow the president’s executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico. The decision handed the AP a major victory at a time the White House has been challenging the press on several levels. 

Good.  This was an absurd move by the Trump administration.

Freedom of the Press !

I wonder how may question Ms Leave-it will take from the AP...

Good. Now to the press corps and media - stop being afraid and start challenging this dimwits. Don't just ask questions assuming they have grade 2 intelligence (they don't) and they not ask what the hell they are talking about? Question them, challenge them. Call out the lies, the disrespect, the abuse, the ignorance - be the public that is demanding these clowns be called out for their stupid antics.

I want them to ask follow up questions. Questions like, “Do you have actual proof of that?”  and “What specifically does that mean?”

I’d take it from the AP or any others that follow Bill Burr’s advice.
Seems like an impeachable offense, we don’t have kings

So basically they’ll appeal it, lose the appeal, and then will send it to SCOTUS, who will come up with some batshit crazy reason to continue to bar the AP. 

There, saved us all some time.

Everyone should go read about the judge who made this ruling. He’s made some extremely questionable decisions that almost exclusively favored the Trump administration and his supporters. Even he is shutting down one of many of the  Trump administrations’ ridiculously unconstitutional attacks on the press.
…. Until it gets to the Supreme Court and they’ll say “welllllll in this administration they can.”
There's not a snowman's chance in hell that this will be followed.

Why should your ordinary citizen submit anything to the IRS, if the IRS is now showing it’s not private? Because what this means is that the IRS will now provide your personal information (and nobody knows that more than the IRS), to whatever authority asks for it.

The only reason this voluntary tax disclosure of very private information to the IRS has lasted as long as it had is because people have trusted that this info will be used by the IRS for tax purposes only, not to be given out freely to ICE or whoever says they need it for unprecedented purposes.

The fact that Ontario’s measles outbreak has drawn concern from New York health officials highlights just how interconnected our public health systems truly are. Measles is a preventable disease, and its resurgence points to dangerous gaps in vaccination coverage and public trust. This isn’t just a local issue — it’s a cross-border wake-up call for stronger immunization strategies and coordinated public health responses.
